notes.text: An update is now available for Red Hat OpenShift GitOps v1.12.3 to address the CVE-2024-31989, Unprivileged pod in a different namespace on the same cluster could connect to the Redis server on port 6379. Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Errata Advisory for Red Hat OpenShift GitOps v1.12.3

Security Fix(es):

* CVE-2024-31989 argocd: unprivileged pod in a different namespace on the same cluster could connect to the Redis server.

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS
score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

cwe.name: Use of a Cryptographic Primitive with a Risky Implementation

notes.text: A flaw was found in the ArgoCD Redis database server. This flaw allows an attacker with access to the Redis server to gain read/write access to the data in Redis. The attacker can also modify the "mfst" (manifest) key to cause ArgoCD to execute any deployment, potentially leveraging ArgoCD's high privileges to take over the cluster.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: argocd: Use of Risky or Missing Cryptographic Algorithms in Redis Cache
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
